definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: Some have fled west to Liberia or east to Ghana.
sentences.chinese: 一些人逃到了西部的利比里亞或東部的加納。

sentences.english: Secretary Clinton addressed Liberia's National Assembly in Monrovia.
sentences.chinese: 克林頓在利比里亞國民大會上發表了演講。

sentences.english: Liberia is one of the few countries in Africa that have not been colonized by Europe.
sentences.chinese: 利比里亞是少數幾個沒有淪爲歐洲殖民地的國家之一。

sentences.english: Just as its neighbor Sierra Leone, Liberia was known for its blood diamonds during the civil war.
sentences.chinese: 和他的鄰居塞拉利昂一樣，利比里亞也以血鑽著稱。

sentences.english: Indeed, Liberia is open for business with America and the world.
sentences.chinese: 的確，利比里亞向美國和全世界開放並與之共同努力。

sentences.english: Liberia's recent history is marked by years of conflict and political instability.
sentences.chinese: 利比里亞近代史的顯著特點是數年的衝突和政治動盪。

sentences.english: This is the third time Liberia has been declared Ebola-free.
sentences.chinese: 這是利比里亞第三次宣佈埃博拉疫情結束。

sentences.english: Junior Minister Issac Jackson says Liberians trust her leadership.
sentences.chinese: 傑克遜說，初級部長伊薩克利比里亞信任她的領導。

sentences.english: The head of Liberia's election commission has said that the run-off vote will go ahead as planned.
sentences.chinese: 利比里亞選舉委員會主席稱，決勝選舉將如期舉行。

sentences.english: Sexual violence was a characterizing feature of the 14-year long civil war in Liberia.
sentences.chinese: 性暴力是利比里亞長達14年之久的內戰的突出特徵。

sentences.english: Dogar, a veteran of Liberia's railway.
sentences.chinese: 他是利比里亞鐵路的老工人。
